text: 11 system hours until Charmony Festival - The other side of Dreamflux Reef
Media:Trailblaze Mission Small Town Grotesque 2.mp4

speaker: Robin
line: Look here, brother! A little bird!

speaker: Sunday
line: Looks like a fledgling Charmony Dove.

speaker: Sunday
line: But Charmony Doves don't live here. So how did this little bird get here? Maybe its parents abandoned it?

speaker: Robin
line: It looks weak and frail... Why don't we find something soft and make a nest for it?

speaker: Sunday
line: This place is too dangerous for a fledgling. Let's take it with us â€” we can put it on the wooden shelf in front of your window.

speaker: Robin
line: Okay! A bird like that must have a beautiful singing voice. But where will it live?

speaker: Sunday
line: I'll ask the family head to build a cage for it.

speaker: Robin
line: A cage... but then it won't have the freedom to fly, right?

speaker: Kind Voice
line: Let's see... what is it that has captured the attention of the two best interpreters of the Great One, to the point that they've forgotten how to enjoy their dessert?

speaker: Kind Voice
line: Oh... poor little thing. Doesn't look like it's doing well. Do you want to rescue it?

speaker: Robin
line: I do... but I don't want to lock it up in a cage.

speaker: Kind Voice
line: Why?

speaker: Robin
line: Even if it's small and not fully feathered, and can't sing... it didn't come into this world just to be locked up in a cage.

speaker: Robin
line: Birds... belong to the sky.

speaker: Kind Voice
line: That's quite the romantic idea. And what about you, our young scholar? Do you agree with your sister?

speaker: Sunday
line: I think she's right... but if we leave it out in the wild, it won't survive for more than a few days at best.

speaker: Kind Voice
line: Ah, I see. It seems our little scholar is still a bit unsure. Well, let me tell you youngsters a story.

speaker: Kind Voice
line: As you probably know, Charmony Doves can fly through the air. When they fly really high, the friction caused by the flapping of their feathers against the atmosphere creates amazing lights, so that they look like shooting stars.

speaker: Kind Voice
line: We've seen this spectacle so many times that we think it's just something they can naturally do... but that's not the truth. Their radiant display is the result of countless struggles against nature over generations.

speaker: Kind Voice
line: Their ancestors were too weak to survive on the ground. So, to escape predators, they started seeking new opportunities in the air...

speaker: Kind Voice
line: After countless attempts by many generations, one of them finally figured out how to fly. It soared into the sky and never looked back at the ground again.

speaker: Robin
line: So, you mean, birds aren't born to fly, but they find a way to do it through their determination, right?

speaker: Kind Voice
line: Well, that's an idealistic way of putting it. So, what are your thoughts, Sunday?

speaker: Sunday
line: I think people believe birds are meant to fly because... they've never seen those birds crashing to their death.

speaker: Kind Voice
line: That's an interesting perspective. So, have you decided what to do with the bird now?

speaker: Sunday
line: For now... I'll keep it in a cage until it can take care of itself because...

speaker: Sunday
line: I... I want it to live, no matter what.

speaker: Kind Voice
line: Well said, kids. It seems each of you has found your own answer. Your insights are truly remarkable, and I hope they come true in their own way.

speaker: Robin
line: We will take good care of it, won't we, brother?

speaker: Sunday
line: Yeah, but Mr. Gopher Wood, there's one thing I don't quite understand...

speaker: Kind Voice
line: And what might that be, my son?

speaker: Sunday
line: What if this little Charmony Dove never learns to fly in the end?

speaker: Sunday
line: I mean, if there are fledglings in this world that can never fly throughout their lives...

speaker: Sunday
line: Should we let them go back to the sky... only to see them crash to the ground and die?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Talking in your sleep, birdie? Time to wake up.

speaker: Gallagher
line: You look a little unsteady. Need a hand?

speaker: Sunday
line: I'm still alive?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Yeah, happy about that?

speaker: Sunday
line: ...Where is Robin? Tell me. Now.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Heh, I knew that was going to be the first thing you'd ask.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Don't worry. Your sister is here, safe and sound. She's... probably walking around the streets now.

speaker: Gallagher
line: If I were you, I'd be more worried about myself... After all, right in front of you is the guy who just stabbed you in the chest with a dagger.

speaker: Sunday
line: If you wanted to kill me, you wouldn't give me the chance to speak... Just tell me your demands, lackey of the Watchmaker.

speaker: Gallagher
line: So, you've figured out who I am, huh? No wonder you had the guts to go against the Dreammaster and the four Families. Looks like I made the right choice.

speaker: Sunday
line: Choice?

speaker: Gallagher
line: You are aware of my plan and see through my Fictionology. Time is running out, so let's drop the charades...

speaker: Gallagher
line: I'm suggesting we cooperate.

speaker: Sunday
line: Cooperate? What makes you think I'd cooperate with you?

speaker: Gallagher
line: The fact that the famous Robin has chosen my side. Plus, some clues about a traitor, and a bright future for Penacony... Any of that catch your interest?

speaker: Sunday
line: I find it hard to believe a man who's full of deception.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Fine, you don't have to trust me. What you should trust is...

speaker: Gallagher
line: The sense of justice inside of you.

speaker: Sunday
line: ...Show me Robin first.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Alright, as you wish. Here she is...

speaker: Sunday
line: What's your trick this time?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Haha, just kidding. I mean, this lady will lead us to Robin, right?

speaker: Firefly
line: And the Crew too. There are too many people who you owe... an explanation.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Haha, that'd be great. Please follow me, honorable Oak Family Head. Now all the actors... are on the stage.

text: Moments later...

speaker: Micah
line: This is the monument I mentioned earlier. The names inscribed on it... should be familiar to all of you.

speaker: Welt
line: Razalina and... Tiernan.

speaker: Micah
line: When Penacony was known as a frontier prison, it was the Trailblazers who connected it with the stars. They were the heroes who saved Asdana, and their names deserve to be immortalized â€” not just on this small stone tablet, but in the annals of history for all of time.

speaker: Micah
line: However, today the Planet of Festivities is nothing but sweet dreams. That heavy piece of history is all a distant memory... just like that prison.

speaker: Robin
line: If their names are inscribed here, then that means...

speaker: Himeko
line: According to Micah, they died long ago.

speaker: Micah
line: Razalina was killed during the War of Independence. She ventured alone into the heart of the star system to investigate the flow of memoria, but she never returned...

speaker: Micah
line: Tiernan was a skilled gunslinger, strong and reliable. He led the people through countless battles, but he didn't live long enough to witness the arrival of true peace.

speaker: Micah
line: In the decade following the War, Penacony faced challenges internal and external. To protect Asdana, Tiernan picked up the way of the Trailblaze again, and led the Lampmoth Family to explore beyond the system, only to be surrounded... and wiped out by the Swarm.

speaker: March 7th
line: Though I had expected as much, the tales of these heroes... truly are sorrowful.

speaker: Himeko
line: True to the title of Trailblazer, they spent their lives venturing into the unknown. But... what about this tablet? There are no names carved on it.

speaker: Gallagher
line: When Dreamflux Reef was created, its owner was still alive. However, he insisted on erecting a monument for himself, saying that "it will happen someday."

speaker: Gallagher
line: Here we meet again, everyone from the Astral Express.

speaker: Sunday
line: Robin...

text: Ask Gallagher about the situation

title: Mission Description
content: You originally thought you would just be meeting with theExpress Crew, but the group you have now amassed is massive... Gallagher, Micah,Misha, Firefly, Robin, Sunday... And it seems that the person who led to the creation of this lively scene was precisely the seemingly indifferent Gallagher himself.If this isn't just because he's lonely and wants to spend some time with everyone, then he must be secretly formulating some kind of shocking conspiracy... Fortunately, he doesn't seem to bear you any ill will. Perhaps you will be able to grasp the full picture of your surrounding situation peacefully.

text: (Talk to Robin and Sunday, optional)

speaker: Robin
line: Brother...!

speaker: Sunday
line: ...There's no need for words. You're safe, and that's all that matters.

text: (Talk to Micah, optional)

speaker: Micah
line: Well I did my job â€” I gathered everyone here. Gallagher will explain the rest to you... Take care.

text: (Talk to Misha, optional)

speaker: Misha
line: Huh? The atmosphere sure has livened up with all these people in here...

text: (Talk to Firefly, optional)

speaker: Firefly
line: I brought Gallagher here. It's time... to face the "truth."

text: (Talk to Gallagher)

speaker: Gallagher
line: I promised to give the siblings some privacy, so let's talk about our business first. What do you say?

speaker: Welt
line: That sounds sensible enough. Since you went through the trouble of gathering The Family head, the Crew, and the Stellaron Hunters , I'm guessing you have something important to say, Mr. Gallagher?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Oh, is it that obvious?

speaker: March 7th
line: The look on your face is practically screaming "I'm the one behind all this..."

speaker: Gallagher
line: Hahaha, you're right, Mr. Yang. It is indeed time to come clean on everything.

speaker: Gallagher
line: The siblings already know what they need to, and they've made their choice. But you Nameless arrived a bit late, so it's only fair that I answer your questions.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Before we begin, let me reintroduce myself. I'm the founder of Dreamflux Reef, the deputy of the Watchmaker, and... the one who sent out that invitation...

speaker: Gallagher
line: As Gallagher the History Fictionologist , I humbly extend my greetings to you all.

speaker: March 7th
line: History Fictionologist? So, what? everything you told us was made up?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Well, don't worry. Almost everything I shared was true... well, except for the part about "The Family accepting me back."

speaker: Himeko
line: I double-checked with Micah, and everything he said about The Family, the Watchmaker, and Mikhail is true.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Thank you for your understanding! Now, let's get down to business. I'm sure you're all wondering why I went through the trouble of setting up this battle for the legacy, inviting different factions, and stirring up a ruckus all over Penacony...

speaker: Gallagher
line: Well, it all boils down to something very familiar to all of you... the Stellaron.

speaker: Welt
line: The Stellaron? But how is that possible? Penacony is a free-flowing interstellar hub. There are no signs of contamination whatsoever.

speaker: Gallagher
line: You're totally correct. So, care to take a guess at what that means?

text: The Stellaron has been completely sealed?

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: I wish that were the truth! But, if that were the case, I wouldn't have invited all of you.

text: Someone is manipulating the Stellaron?

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: How keen! Well, what should I say? I expected nothing less from the person here who is the most familiar with Stellarons.

text: You're pulling our leg again!

speaker: Gallagher
line: The sweet dream doesn't come out of thin air. If you think of the Memory Zone as the sea, creating the land of the dreams is like filling that wild ocean with earth to make an island.

speaker: Gallagher
line: To achieve this feat, without the help of an Emanator of Remembrance or Enigmata, the only way is to use a Stellaron.

speaker: Gallagher
line: And that's not something you can achieve with a simple wish. It requires vast quantities of knowledge, time, and manpower. I'm sure you get what I'm hinting at...

speaker: Gallagher
line: In Asdana, the Planet of Festivities itself is a Stellaron disaster.

speaker: March 7th
line: The Planet of Festivities itself... is a Stellaron disaster?

speaker: Gallagher
line: It all started a long time ago. Back when the Watchmaker and his crew liberated the frontier prison, they faced countless challenges as they began building Penacony from the ground up. That's when the idea of using the Stellaron came into play.

speaker: Gallagher
line: The Stellaron first entered the Asdana system during the war. The Nameless warned everyone against the folly of attempting to tamper with such a power, and most heeded their words. But, there are always people in the shadows with ulterior motives.

speaker: Gallagher
line: The turning point came after Tiernan's death. With two of the Nameless gone, the Watchmaker had to go to the front lines. It was at that moment his rivals saw an opportunity.

speaker: Gallagher
line: By the time a representative from the Montour system's Family arrived at the Watchmaker's call, the Stellaron had already been activated and was seeping into the primordial Synesthesia Dreamscape.

speaker: Himeko
line: And I suppose The Family happened to possess the knowledge to seal the Stellaron?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Not just that! They knew far more about the Stellaron than the average person. They helped Mikhail swiftly quell the civil unrest and played a part in building Penacony, under the disguise of the Harmony.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Those three eras were known as the Age of Dreaming. The Watchmaker, who had been left in the dark, sent out invitations across the universe, spreading the hype around the land of the dreams.

speaker: March 7th
line: Then... how did they turn against each other?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Remember the island-in-the-ocean metaphor? The truth is, the Stellaron was never truly sealed. It existed in a different form within the Dreamscape. Think about this â€” what would it cost to create and maintain such a lavish dreamland?

speaker: Gallagher
line: It's people's lives. The opulent dream is built upon the decay of spirits, with a toxic elixir called "pleasure" flowing through the Dreamscape. It tempts people to indulge in the Dreamscape, and gradually their minds succumb, becoming nourishment for the sweet dream.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Confusion, laziness, and cowardice... weaknesses that plague humanity were magnified and nourished by The Family. Penacony became a new kind of prison, even more impenetrable than the previous one.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Sadly, we realized this far too late. By then, The Family had a firm grip on Penacony, swiftly quelling any opposition that arose.

speaker: Gallagher
line: At my wit's end, I had to use the power of the Enigmata and sought refuge in this chaotic Memory Zone. Over the years, I fabricated a meme within this dream for our use...

speaker: Gallagher
line: "Dormancy," that's its real name. We exploited a loophole â€” you see, regular people can't fall asleep again while they are inside the Dreamscape.

speaker: Himeko
line: So, this is the true meaning of "the impossible." You sent out invitations in the Watchmaker's name to find forces capable of resolving the Stellaron disaster and draw them in to Penacony to uncover the truth?

speaker: Gallagher
line: It's not just that. Above all, I wanted to see what happens when the major factions engage in a struggle for the legacy. Since this is the Watchmaker's first announcement in decades, the traitor within The Family is bound to reveal themselves.

speaker: March 7th
line: So, the legacy is just a facade...

speaker: Gallagher
line: If you want to consider the Stellaron as the legacy, I'm totally fine with that.

speaker: Himeko
line: If that's the case, where is the Stellaron now?

speaker: Gallagher
line: That's a question for Mr. Wings. The Stellaron is still under The Family's control, and as the head of the Oak Family , I'm sure he holds all the answers.

text: (Talk to Gallagher, optional)

speaker: Gallagher
line: Go ahead. I'm sure Mr. Wings holds all the answers.

text: (Talk to Firefly, optional)

speaker: Firefly
line: As I suspected, the core of this issue lies within... the Stellaron.

text: (Talk to Misha, optional)

speaker: Misha
line: You all look quite serious... Is there anything I can do to help?

text: Learn the whereabouts of the Stellaron from Sunday

title: Step Description
content: You originally thought you would just be meeting with the Express Crew, but the group you have now amassed is massive... Gallagher, Micah, Misha, Firefly, Robin, Sunday... And, it seems that the person that led to the creation of this lively scene was precisely the seemingly indifferent Gallagher himself.He shares the true nature of the Planet of Festivities with the Express Crew: It is a deliberate and controlled Stellaron disaster. However, as for the current location of the Stellaron, he cannot be sure... Now, all you can do is hope that the seemingly rebellious Family leader, Sunday, will cooperate with your work.

text: (Talk to Robin and Sunday)

speaker: Gallagher
line: Are you done talking? So, will you tell us where the Stellaron is?

speaker: Sunday
line: It... is the Penacony Grand Theater itself.

speaker: Robin
line: As I suspected. It's the embodiment of The Family, the edifice that first materialized within the sweet dream... That's what turned Penacony into its current state.

speaker: Sunday
line: As for the person who employed its power... It is in fact Mr. Gopher Wood, the current Dreammaster.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Well, that was easier than I thought. Did you conduct your own investigation already?

speaker: Sunday
line: Correct. When I was trying to track down the person who murdered my sister, apart from you... Gopher Wood was my second suspect.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Confronting me first turned out to be a smart move on your part.

speaker: Sunday
line: I didn't have other options. The Dreammaster has been elusive, and even the heads of the Families can hardly get an audience with him.

speaker: Sunday
line: Moreover... Mr. Gopher Wood has been kind to my sister and me, and I didn't want it all to end like this.

speaker: Himeko
line: What do you mean by that?

speaker: Robin
line: To be honest, my brother and I are also victims of the Cancer of All Worlds. We grew up as orphans and were adopted by The Family when they came to help. Mr. Gopher Wood recognized our potential and brought us to Penacony.

speaker: Robin
line: But I can't just stand by and watch Mr. Gopher Wood become an enemy of the Harmony. I won't use my voice to support an evil cause...

speaker: Robin
line: I won't step on that stage and sing, no matter who the traitor is or what orders they give me. I won't let the Charmony Festival become an event that destroys Harmony itself...

speaker: Robin
line: For the paradise in our dreams.

speaker: Sunday
line: Indeed... for the paradise in our dreams.

speaker: Sunday
line: As the head of the Oak Family, I'm responsible for ensuring Penacony's promising future. Robin and I will head into the sweet dream and confront the Dreammaster, and if it turns out that The Family has truly strayed from the Harmony...

speaker: Sunday
line: I'll fight alongside you. We'll put the Charmony Festival on hold and make sure Mr. Gopher Wood pays for his blood debt.

speaker: Gallagher
line: The enemies you are about to face aren't like this old dog here, who can barely even bark...

speaker: Gallagher
line: Since our interests are aligned, why don't we team up? Maybe, just maybe, we'll have a shot at success.

speaker: Himeko
line: We have always been following in the footsteps of our Nameless predecessors, and there's no reason to stop now.

speaker: March 7th
line: â–¶ Yeah, we Nameless won't back down from a challenge! Isn't that right, (Trailblazer)?

text: Ain't nothing to fear no more!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Ah... that line actually makes me a bit nervous...

text: Heroes never back down.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Exactly! It's time for the Crew to save the world once more!

text: Going up against the Dreammaster? Nah, I'd surrender.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Come on. Don't crack jokes at such a serious moment.

speaker: Welt
line: Rest assured â€” sitting on the sidelines isn't in our nature. Mr. Sunday, Miss Robin, I'm willing to accompany you on behalf of the Astral Express. Having a third party present should help with negotiations... and could make all the difference if things get ugly.

speaker: Sunday
line: Thank you, Mr. Yang.

speaker: Robin
line: Thank you all very much.

speaker: Sunday
line: The Charmony Festival is about to start, and time is against us. We must hasten.

text: See what Welt has to say

title: Step Description
content: All related parties present have reached a consensus to eliminate the Stellaron. The righteous and upstanding Halovian siblings have even expressed willingness to utilize their identities to seek out a resolution from inside The Family itself.Though things seem to be developing satisfactorily, Welt still has some doubts... Go and see his views on the matter.

speaker: Welt
line: Everyone, let's gather over here â€” we still need to make some preparations.

text: (Talk to Welt)

speaker: Welt
line: I may have been quick to step up to the plate, but confronting the Dreammaster could be a very dangerous affair.

speaker: March 7th
line: Huh? Even you're saying that, Mr. Yang? How powerful is that Dreammaster?

speaker: Himeko
line: He's the leader of the Families of Penacony, and he has the entire power of the Harmony behind him... not to mention the Stellaron in his possession. We must proceed with great caution.

speaker: March 7th
line: Maybe you can just stay behind this time, Mr. Yang...?

speaker: Welt
line: No, that won't do. Even if we count Robin as an ally, something felt off about Mr. Sunday just now, although I can't quite put my finger on it... I have to make sure he won't turn against us when things start to get dicey.

speaker: Welt
line: â–¶ You're still carrying the keepsake the IPC envoy gave you, right, (Trailblazer)? May I borrow it for a moment?

text: (SubmitAventurine's Token)

speaker: Welt
line: Huh... I knew it.

text: What do you need it for?
I don't think this'll bring us any luck....

speaker: Welt
line: As I suspected, this chip Aventurine gave to you... is actually a miniature transmitter.

speaker: Welt
line: If I'm right, he intends to use it to track your location or contact you when needed. As it so happens, this may actually be of some use in the current situation.

speaker: March 7th
line: Aventurine? Is he still alive...? And what does he have to do with our mission to confront the Dreammaster?

speaker: Welt
line: Remember what I said earlier? Working with the IPC is a way to keep The Family in check.

speaker: Welt
line: If negotiations go south and The Family show their true colors by going after the Stellaron, I'll use this transmitter to send a message to the IPC. It'll be just the opportunity the IPC Ambassador was hoping for.

speaker: Welt
line: The only question mark in all this is Aventurine's current status... but the IPC is always listening, especially senior Strategic Investment Department heads like him. Getting the message across shouldn't be a problem.

speaker: Himeko
line: ...Good luck to you, Welt.

speaker: Welt
line: Well, you take care too. If anything goes wrong... don't worry about me. Just make sure to seal the Stellaron.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Spoken like a true hero.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Even if the Dreammaster is innocent, The Family's corruption runs deep. I won't make the same mistake Mikhail did. Let's wish him the best of luck...

speaker: Himeko
line: Don't you have something else to tell us, Gallagher?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Why would you say so?

speaker: Himeko
line: Before we departed, the conductor asked us to inquire about the three Nameless in Penacony. We've already collected intel about Razalina and Tiernan, so the only one left is Legwork.

speaker: Himeko
line: If I'm not mistaken... we've already met him somewhere, haven't we?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Hm... it's not enough to say "meet," but the answer is pretty obvious. After all, I've hinted at it in quite an evident way.

speaker: Gallagher
line: I've been watching over you ever since I received the reply from the Astral Express, and I've seen the great effort you all put into linking different realms together across the cosmos. And now, after getting this far all in one piece, you have truly proven yourselves.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Miss Himeko, were you the one who repaired the Express and got it sailing through the cosmos again?

speaker: Himeko
line: Yes.

speaker: Gallagher
line: And you two young Nameless... you have very interesting life stories and extraordinary skills.

text: Awww, you're making me blush with these flatteries....Keep them coming'!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: I don't know much about my life story... but I do have extraordinary skills!

text: Ha, of course, my reputation precedes me. Believe in the Galactic Baseballer supremacy!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: What...? Hey, you can't just make up "titles" like that!

speaker: Gallagher
line: Heh, you're full of energy. Please send my regards to... the conductor, Pom-Pom . Please let them know that their friend has fond memories from his time aboard the Express, which he reminisces on every time he has a good drink.

speaker: Gallagher
line: As for the last Nameless... he embarked, disembarked, and embarked again... traveling in a great circle and ending up back where he started.

speaker: Gallagher
line: On his deathbed, he told me to find the Astral Express and deliver an invitation to the future Nameless. He left behind a special gift, a true "legacy"... something that belongs only to the successors of the Trailblaze.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Come with me. Now... is the time to reveal it.

text: Follow Gallagher and meet with the "Watchmaker"

title: Step Description
content: Welt points out the severity of the situation and how one must always be prepared for the worst-case scenario. In an effort to avert the unthinkable, he bids a solemn farewell to everyone before throwing himself into the fray by accompanying theHaloviansiblings on their journey to open negotiations with the Dreammaster. This leaves you to continue searching for other ways to avert the situation. To this end, Gallagher finally becomes willing to reveal the whole truth... Due to his innate distrust of The Family, he had not previously exposed everything regarding the "Watchmaker."Gallagher explains that the "Watchmaker" seems to have left behind a precious inheritance for the Astral Express... And that this inheritance could perhaps be the key to sealing the Stellaron.

speaker: March 7th
line: Back here again...

speaker: Gallagher
line: Sometimes I feel like you're still alive, old friend, like you've still got so much to say and do.

speaker: Gallagher
line: I've kept my promise... brought the future Trailblazers you've waited so long for. I don't know why you were so obsessed with that train, but I remember your last words...

speaker: Gallagher
line: Don't let us down, old man.

text: (Cutscene plays)

speaker: March 7th
line: What's happening!?

text: (Cutscene ends)

speaker: Gallagher
line: Go ahead. His resting place... lies in the garden up ahead.

speaker: Gallagher
line: The first and last Nameless of Penacony...

speaker: Gallagher
line: Mikhail Char Legwork, the Watchmaker.

text: Meet with the "Watchmaker"
Beneath the sea surface of Memory Zone, in a garden closest to the full moon in the water, an elderly man rests on a recliner, enveloped in utter silence.
The Watchmaker, Mikhail Char Legwork, has passed into that endless, timeless dream, where no sound could ever awaken him.

speaker: March 7th
line: Sure enough... the Watchmaker is the third Nameless. Even I could guess that one.

speaker: Gallagher
line: The legacy he left behind was a dream bubble. I believe inside that bubble, there's something that holds meaning only for the Nameless.

speaker: Gallagher
line: After all, when I checked its contents, I found nothing inside ... Maybe some Trailblaze runes? Even more enigmatic than me.

speaker: Himeko
line: Well, let's have a look.

text: As the words cease, Himeko nods ever so slightly in your direction. You take a deep breath, steady your mind, and turn your gaze towards the Watchmaker...
Touch the dream bubble in Mikhail's hand.

You press your hands against the dream bubble and the thick viscous memoria converges under strain, then stretches outward from your fingertips. As if weaving a delicate web, it gently cradles your palm.
A chill travels from your fingertips, carrying with it a myriad of vibrant and intertwined memories, as experience would suggest...
But this time, you see nothing at all.
How could this be?
Try to focus and capture memories...
Take a deep breath and try to read the dream bubble again...

The dream bubble is clearly extraordinary. Perhaps the approach was wrong, you think, holding your breath and closing your eyes. With one knee on the ground, you press your forehead against the thin film coated in memoria.

Yet, before you, there remains an abyss of darkness. No crimson sun descending upon snow-capped mountains, no gentle laughter, no twinkling stars, no echoes of swords clashing, and most of all, no traces of "trailblaze"...

speaker: empty dream bubble
line: ...There is nothing and nothing is there. Indubitably, this is but an .

speaker: March 7th
line: Wait, what's going on...?

speaker: March 7th
line: Seriously... there's nothing inside this dream bubble?

speaker: March 7th
line: How could a dream bubble be empty?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Hmph, just as I suspected.

speaker: Gallagher
line: That old man always had this strange belief in the Nameless and the Trailblaze, and I never understood where he got that confidence from... especially since he never managed to get in touch with the Express while he was alive.

speaker: Gallagher
line: I could never figure out what was going on in that old man's head, but this empty dream bubble is so typical of him. He was always full of weird fantasies... and incomprehensible romanticism.

speaker: Gallagher
line: That mischievous old man... Well, I didn't expect him to leave anything concrete behind anyway.

speaker: Himeko
line: Don't think that's the case, Gallagher. I'm sure Mikhail has left us the most precious thing of all.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Heh, don't start getting all philosophical on me, alright?

speaker: Himeko
line: Just as Mikhail believes in the Nameless of the future, we unconditionally believe in the Nameless of the past. How could they leave with regrets for the future when they were ready to dedicate their lives to the land they loved?

speaker: Himeko
line: There must be something contained in this dream bubble. It's just we haven't figured it out yet. You also have faith in the Watchmaker, don't you, Gallagher?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Well, I'm a follower of the Enigmata. My philosophy forbids me to have faith in anything.

speaker: Gallagher
line: ...That's why I understand what "faith" means in the Path of Trailblaze, and I also want to know what he left behind. Heh, I'll leave it to you guys then.

speaker: Himeko
line: Can I borrow your pet ? I need to make a trip back to Golden Hour and check something at the Dreamscape Sales Store...

speaker: Himeko
line: It's for Mikhail, and for the future of Penacony.

text: Boothill comes to an agreement with Dan Heng. They will now try to infiltrate the sweet dream and save their friends...
